lifeSupport.name: Life Support Unit
lifeSupport.description: Basic life support providing heat, oxygen, and a safe environment for 20 hull points of ship space.

lifeSupport.name: Autosupport Unit
lifeSupport.description: Advanced automated life support system covering 40 hull points of ship space.

lifeSupport.name: Symbiotic Hull
lifeSupport.description: Biomechanical life support covering 100 hull points and providing recycling for 20 people.

accommodations.name: Crew/Troop Bunkroom
accommodations.description: Basic berthing for 20 crewmen with bunks, includes one airlock.

accommodations.name: Crew Quarters
accommodations.description: Shared quarters for 6 crewmen with common facilities, includes one airlock.

accommodations.name: Staterooms
accommodations.description: Staterooms for 2 crewmen with common facilities, includes one airlock.

accommodations.name: Seating Deck
accommodations.description: Short-term seating for 20 passengers, suitable for brief trips.

accommodations.name: Passenger Bunkroom (3rd class)
accommodations.description: Basic berthing for 20 passengers with bunks, includes one airlock.

accommodations.name: Cryogenics Unit
accommodations.description: Cryogenic suspension pods for 12 people in frozen stasis.

accommodations.name: Life Suspension Unit
accommodations.description: Advanced suspended animation for 12 people who don't age or require provisions.

storeSystems.name: Hydroponics Bay
storeSystems.description: Self-sustaining ecosystem that feeds 10 people, reducing stores consumption.

storeSystems.name: Recycler Unit
storeSystems.description: Recaptures biomass to reduce stores consumption to 10% for 20 people.

storeSystems.name: Deep Stores
storeSystems.description: Additional storage capacity adding 1,000 days of stores.

gravitySystems.name: Spin System
gravitySystems.description: A ship designed to spin on its axis as it travels forward, using centrifugal force to simulate the force of gravity. This acceleration is toward the skin of the ship, so the ship must be designed so that the 'floor' is the outside surface of the spinning hull sections.
